genKillFramework

Class DataFlowAnalysis<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • genKillFramework.DataFlowAnalysis<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of information stored for the data flow analysis.

    public abstract class DataFlowAnalysis<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates the Gen/Kill framework for a data flow analysis. Implement this interface to generate a specific data flow analysis.
    Author:
    Joe Godbehere, Ricky Ratnayake, Craig Sketchley

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DataFlowAnalysis.Direction
      Enum to represent the direction of the analysis FORWARDS : From entry point to exit point BACKWARDS : From exit point to entry point

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataFlowAnalysis(cfg.ControlFlowGraph cfg)
      Creates the in and out information mappings for the given control flow graph.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract java.util.Map<cfg.Node,T> analyse()
      Given a control flow graph, it will analyse it and produce an analysis result as a mapping from nodes to information.
      java.util.Map<cfg.Node,T> analyse(DataFlowAnalysis.Direction direction)
      Given a control flow graph and a direction to analyse it, it will analyse it and produce an analysis result as a mapping from nodes to information

      The Gen operation of the Gen/Kill framework.

      The transfer function of the Gen/Kill framework.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataFlowAnalysis

        public DataFlowAnalysis(cfg.ControlFlowGraph cfg)
        Creates the in and out information mappings for the given control flow graph.
        Parameters:
        cfg - the control flow graph to analyse.

    • Method Detail

      • gen

        public abstract T gen(cfg.Node n)
        The Gen operation of the Gen/Kill framework. Returns the set of information that is generated for the given node.
        Parameters:
        n - the node to identify the Gen set for.
        Returns:
        the data flow information to Gen for the given node.

      • kill

        public abstract T kill(cfg.Node n)
        The Kill operation of the Gen/Kill framework. Returns the set of information to be killed for the given node.
        Parameters:
        n - the Node to identify the kill set for.
        Returns:
        the data flow information to Kill for the given node.

      • meet

        public abstract T meet(cfg.Node n)
        The meet operator of the Gen/Kill framework. Given a node, combines all the IN/OUT of it's successors/predecessors, depending on the type of analysis implemented. Handles the OUT[B] = meet(IN[B]) or IN[B] = meet(OUT[B]) internally for each node
        Parameters:
        n - the node on which to apply the meet function.
        Returns:
        the data flow information after the meet operation has been applied.

      • updateDataFlowInfo

        public abstract boolean updateDataFlowInfo(java.util.Map<cfg.Node,T> map,
                                           cfg.Node n)
        Update the map with meet data of node n
        Parameters:
        map - the map to update (IN/OUT) for the given node
        n - the node to update the data flow information
        Returns:
        true if the map size changed

      • transfer

        public abstract T transfer(cfg.Node n)
        The transfer function of the Gen/Kill framework. Handles the transfer IN[B] = transfer(OUT[B]) or OUT[B] = transfer(IN[B]) internally for each node
        Parameters:
        n - the node on which to apply the transfer function.
        Returns:
        the data flow information after the transfer function has been applied.

      • analyse

        public abstract java.util.Map<cfg.Node,T> analyse()
        Given a control flow graph, it will analyse it and produce an analysis result as a mapping from nodes to information.
        Returns:
        returns a mapping from node to data flow information, depending on the implemented analysis.

      • analyse

        public java.util.Map<cfg.Node,T> analyse(DataFlowAnalysis.Direction direction)
        Given a control flow graph and a direction to analyse it, it will analyse it and produce an analysis result as a mapping from nodes to information
        Parameters:
        direction - indicates the direction the analysis is performed.
        Returns:
        returns a mapping from node to data flow information, depending on the implemented analysis.
